meanings.sent1: The sponge is saturable, meaning it can hold a lot of water.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel is saturable, allowing it to absorb spills quickly.
meanings.sent3: The bucket was so saturable that it seemed to never get full no matter how much water was poured in.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a saturable sponge, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The soil in the garden was so saturable that even a small rain shower caused flooding.

meanings.definition: Able to reach a point of maximum capacity.
meanings.sent1: The balloon is saturable, meaning it can only be filled with a certain amount of air before it bursts.
meanings.sent2: The hard drive is saturable, reaching its maximum storage capacity quickly.
meanings.sent3: The refrigerator was so saturable with food that the door could barely close.
meanings.sent4: His schedule was like a saturable container, always reaching its limit with appointments.
meanings.sent5: The parking lot was saturable, with every spot filled to capacity during the event.

meanings.sent1: The fabric is saturable, easily absorbing any spilled liquids.
meanings.sent2: The soil in the garden is saturable, becoming waterlogged after heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The air was so saturable with moisture that it felt like walking through a cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was like a saturable material, becoming frizzy in humid weather.
meanings.sent5: The market was saturable with shoppers during the holiday sale, making it hard to move around.
